decision_conditions:
<p><span style="line-height: 115%;">The submitted existing and proposed plans fail to
show the full scope of the development on the site; the drawings therefore
clearly differ to what currently exists on site with existing and proposed plans
not clearly showing the existing outbuilding within the rear amenity space. As
such, the local planning authority is unable to make a comprehensive and
objective assessment of the proposed development with regards to the overall impact
on character and amenity contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3 of the London Plan
(2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the
Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>

<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed rear extension by reason of its
excessive scale, depth, location and positioning in relation to the adjoining
property at no. 18 Prescelly Place would give rise to a bulky and obtrusive
form of development which would result in moderate harm to the light and
outlook of the adjoining dwelling house; an unacceptable impact to their
amenity. The proposal is therefore contrary to the high-quality design
aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3 of
the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and
the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
